alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 24 at 3:59AM AKST until December 25 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches along the southern Bristol Bay coast and 4 to 6 inches along the northern Bristol Bay coast. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Visibilities reduced to as low as 1/2 mile from Dillingham north and west and from Port Heiden to King Salmon. * WHERE...Bristol Bay coast. * WHEN...Until 1 AM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A surface low tracking across the Alaska Peninsula will continue to bring snow into the area. Snow will move from the Alaska Peninsula and track northward along the Bristol Bay coast through early Sunday. Gusty northerly winds will accompany the snowfall and result in blowing snow coincident with reduced visibilities.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
